fields.headline: Major importers ban US beef
fields.bodyText: Welcome to the Informer, Guardian Unlimited's 2pm news round-up. THE NEWS IN 90 SECONDS South Africa and Russia today became the latest countries to suspend US beef imports after the United States recorded its first ever case of mad cow disease. Full story Teenager Lee Boyd Malvo was sentenced yesterday to life imprisonment rather than execution for his part in the sniper attacks that terrorised Washington DC late last year. Full story Four people were killed and at least 20 wounded today when a car bomb exploded outside government buildings in the northern Iraqi city of Arbil. Full story Fizzy drinks giant Coca-Cola is removing its branding from vending machines in Scottish schools under a deal aimed at promoting better nutrition among schoolchildren. Full story EDITOR'S PICK Val d'Isere's high altitude guarantees snow but it's no gentle ride for a novice. Second-time skier Gwyn Topham takes the plunge and finds it's not always a downhill struggle. In too steep ROME DISPATCH With the season of goodwill approaching, a social outcast gave Italy a "lesson in humanity", reports John Hooper. Full report AND FINALLY Dennis Johnson sent this December 21 cutting from the letters page of the Flint Journal in Michigan: "On Dec 14, the song of praise being sung at Camp David will be found on page 710 of your hymnal. "We will be led by George W Bush and Dick Cheney and accompanied by the Halliburton Boys Choir. Let us all rejoice and sing along: Bringing in the oil, bringing in the oil We will come rejoicing, Bringing in the oil! Julie J Hubbard, Clio." * The Informer welcomes unusual news reports and intriguing columns. (We're especially keen to hear from multilingual readers living abroad who can spot interesting stories in their local press). Email them to informer@guardianunlimited.co.uk, and please include a source. The Informer, like the Guardian, will be taking a break on Christmas Day and Boxing Day. We will return on Monday. Merry Christmas, everyone.
